owl:Ontology.dc:author: Ganesh Ramanathan
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: An ontology for describing electro-mechanical systems and its automation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Relates an acutator to the port of a component where the action is effective
Relates a sensor to a port where a variable is observed

A peripheral (sensor or actuator) may be related to a port in such a way that the variable it act upon or observes is primarily located at the port. For example, to state heating coil air outlet temperature, or pump inlet valve.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Input of continuous values. For example temperature or pressure.
Output of continous value. For example, to command the position of a valve.

A computational hardware that hosts a control program. The hardware consists of a CPU which may be wired to input-output and communication network interfaces. Typically, the control program can be downloaded in to such a device or the device may contain pre-loaded programs that can be activated.
Concepts around the hardware for execution of the control program and network communication
Concepts around the software implementation of the control and coordination logic in an automation system
Input that is bi-state. For example state of a window as being open or close
A bi-state output. For example, to command a relay tro be on or off
A data payload that is sent over a communication interface
A software program that is designed to perceive the state of the controlled environment and take actions to manipulate its state.
The hardware interface through which an AutomationController interacts with the external world
The description of how components (and the mechanisms they manage) should coordinate in order to orchestrate a physical process together.
Data that is in any arbitrary form that may be additionally described using a schema.
Arbitary data output which may be described using a schema
An object-oriented representation of a program interface that captures the semantics and the modeling of the values.
The physical form of input of output that is interfaced to the AutomationController
Description of a programs behaviour in terms of its states and transitions
A digital or digital-to-analog interface used by an AutomationController to recieve or receive analog signals
A digital or digital-to-analog interface used by an AutomationController to send analog signals
A parameter that constraints the highest possible value of another datapoint
A datapoint that represents information input to a control program
A parameter that constraints some value
A parameter that constraints the lowest possible value of another datapoint
Input in muliple discrete state. For example, current speed of a fan as stage 1, 2, or 3.
Output in multiple discrete states. For example to command the speed of fan to off, stage-1, stage-2 etc.
The communication interface used by an AutomationController to send messages over a network
A parameter that states the shift of value
The output of a control program
An externally supplied value that is used by the control program
The interaction interface offerered by a control program. This can be used to feed input and parameteric data to it, and it can be used by the program to express the desired action.
A model that describes the internal behaviour of a control program
A mock-up unit that simulates the control program
A parameter that constraints the rate of change of a value
A parameter that states the desired value to be achieved, maintained, or avoided by control program
The interface through which an AutomationController interacts with a human. For example, push buttons, displays, and LEDs
